_header: It is so pretty in every degree
_description: The deluded lover — four quatrains and 2-line refrain

NYPLDrexFr4180.Transcription:
…please alake good Jone what may [ ][ ]y shall be [ ]e [ ]oll
                    by swyt sent denys by swete seynt denys[ ]Hyt ys so praty in
                    euery degre a good [ ][ ]avour & in facion lo [ ][ ] see but hit
                    were an angell of þe [ ][ ] of þe tri[ ][ ][ ] ym
                    þat wuld of such recreacion þat god hath ordenyd in vs
                    fyrst…
NYPLDrexFr4180.Note:
Portions of pages cut away to fit as endleaves to seventeenth-century
                    song book.

Stevens,  John,
                        ed.  
             Music and Poetry in the Early Tudor Court.
         London: Methuen, 1961: 377-8.
